text: I love roast chicken I love making them
at home I love doing any kind of
seasonal vegetables onto the tray with
them so that they get basted in the
chicken fat as they're cooking so today
I'm making a roasted chicken with sweet
potatoes cauliflower and rosemary and it
is pretty stunning if I do say so myself
that was three sweet potatoes scrubbed
really well skin on cut them into four
wedges each I just think that this
combination is magical the rosemary you
have to be careful with it because it
can be a little bit overwhelming but
with the sweetness of the sweet potatoes
is really good and then to offset the
sweetness I add some capers about
halfway through the cooking and they get
crunchy and you guys you'll see mince
your rosemary you want pretty even
distribution so get it pretty small
doesn't have to be like completely
completely finely minced but just small
enough that you're not putting like a
whole needle of rosemary in your mouth
because that's not pleasant
nobody wants okay so into this bowl and
over here I have a half a head of
cauliflower it depends on the size of
your cauliflower but this is probably
close to like six or eight cups and I've
just cut them into sort of pretty big
florets you want them big enough that
they don't turn to mush because they're
gonna roast for about an hour to that
add your sweet potatoes one and a half
teaspoons of the rosemary I'm gonna
measure it because I don't want it to
get overwhelming Lee rosemary II but I
think I did pretty well see how close
was I I pride myself on this it's kind
of stupid but yeah look not that much
left on my board
I was pretty good you also need two
ounces of pancetta cut into say
half-inch pieces it's not a lot but it
does add a lot of flavor and it sort of
coats everything and then every once in
a while you get this little bite this
little crunchy bite of roasted pancetta
into your bowl to that add three
tablespoons of olive oil and while you
have the olive oil in your hand you can
also just drizzle some olive oil over
your chicken it's a four pound chicken
that I have here
it's nice and dry you want it dry the
dryer it is the crisper the skin will
get so that was kind of a generous
amount of olive oil you're gonna rub
that all over but first you want to toss
your vegetables you want to season them
with salt and pepper the pancetta is a
little bit salty but not salty enough to
season everything so season and you can
season your chicken as well all right
I'm doing it and rubbing it I'm just
trying to avoid robbing it so I wouldn't
have to wash my hands but put your
chicken on your baking sheet have your
oven preheating to 450 degrees and then
just use a rimmed baking sheet I like a
rimmed baking sheet for roasting my
chicken better than a roasting pan
because it doesn't have high sides and
the chicken can get brown all over so
just put your chicken on your baking
sheet and then surround it with
vegetables the vegetables are not going
to be in a single layer in the beginning
but don't worry about it as they cook
down
they will crisp up and get nice and
brown it might seem a little bit crowded
in the beginning I'm not tying the legs
I'm not tucking the wingtips just
putting it and definitely get all the
pancetta go wash your hands now what you
want to do is get this into the oven
it's 450 for about 25 minutes and after
25 minutes you're gonna add a few
tablespoons of capers and then you're
gonna roast it until the chicken is
cooked through all the vegetables are
golden brown that'll be like 25 to 35
more minutes okay you're gonna want to
